<JD_START>
Job Title: Senior FPGA Engineer

Location: Clarksburg, MD

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
Overview

Thales Defense & Security, Inc. is a global company serving the defense, federal, and commercial markets with innovative solutions for the ground tactical, airborne and avionics, naval/maritime, and public safety and security domains. In addition to mission-critical communication systems, the company provides helmet-mounted displays and motion tracking technologies; SATCOM terminals; advanced sonar systems; air traffic management navigation, surveillance, and simulation; and data protection solutions. Furthermore, the company serves as a gateway for technology, leveraging Thales-wide solutions—such as combat management systems; naval, airborne, and ground ISR; and electronic warfare—to address U.S. requirements.

We are seeking an  FGPA Software Engineer to work in our Clarksburg MD office. You will be part of small product development teams working with extremely talented, motivated people who take pride in knowing our products perform when it counts. You will also be able to see your design and development being manufactured right in our factory.

Top Benefits

 Competitive Salary  Yearly Incentive Bonus Program  Generous 401(k) program - up to 7% company contribution and 100% immediate vesting  Tuition Reimbursement  Paid wellness, vacation, and holiday leave  Paid maternity, paternity, and parental leave  9/80 Work Schedule (every other Friday off) 


Responsibilities

 Participate in FPGA architecture design.  Develop FPGA code and test bench development.  System integration and test on target platforms.  System functions and performance evaluation in LAB.  Participate in TDSI Agile/SCRUM software development process.  Maintain a high ethical standard of practice, including compliance with all company procedures.  Develop signal processing, communication protocol software for an advanced communication system. 


Qualifications

The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

 U.S. Citizenship Required.  Ability to obtain and maintain US Secret Level Security Clearance upon hire.  BS in EE with at least four years relevant experience or MS in EE with minimum 2 years of professional experience.  Experience in FPGA programming in Verilog and/or VHDL HDL languages.  Experience in FPGA development tools such as ModelSim, Synplify Pro, Altera/XILINX tools etc.  Knowledge in meta-stability and timing analysis.  Understanding of wireless communication theory and MODEM development is a plus.  Good communication skills and self-motivation.  Ability to comply with all Company guidelines, policies, procedures and embrace Company Core Values. 


For specific questions about this job posting, candidates may contact the recruiter at careers@thalesdsi.com.

 Thales champions inclusion and we believe diversity strengthens the fabric of our culture. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer/AA/Minorities/Females/Veterans/Disabled. Thales is an E-Verify employer. 

 Thales is an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, age or any other characteristic protected by law. 

 If you need an accommodation or assistance in order to apply for a position with Thales, please call Human Resources at 202-961-1016.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
<JD_END>
